title: Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) visa
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== Subclass 884 Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) visa This temporary visa lets the aged parent of a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident or eligible New Zealand citizen stay temporarily in Australia. Personalise this page... For Applicants For Sponsors Overview About this visa Eligibility Step by step When you have this visa Overview About this visa Eligibility Step by step When you have this visa Overview From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, see Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications Stay 2 years Cost From AUD34,170.00 over 2 instalments for a single applicant. For more information on additional fees that may apply, see the Costs section on About this visa Processing times The demand for Parent visas is greater than the number of places available each year. As a result, processing times for these applications are lengthy. For an indication of processing times for this visa see Parent visa queue release dates. With this visa you can live in Australia for up to 2 years work and study in Australia (you will not receive government support) apply for a permanent Contributory Aged Parent (subclass 864) visa See all conditions Check your eligibility You must have an eligible child who is a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident or eligible New Zealand citizen be old enough to receive the age pension in Australia not have already applied for or hold a Sponsored Parent (Temporary) (Subclass 870) visa when applying for this visa. Help with your visa If you are getting help with your visa, before you pay someone, read information on Who can help with your visa application Process About this visa From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, see Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications With this visa you can How long you can stay Stay longer Include family Cost Apply from Processing times Your obligations Visa label With this visa you can live in Australia for up to 2 years work and study in Australia (you will not receive government support) apply for a permanent Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864) Apply for a Contributory Aged Parent (subclass 864) visa You can apply for the permanent subclass 864 visa as a two-step process by first applying for a Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) subclass 884 visa. Applying for the subclass 884 visa and then the subclass 864 visa allows you to spread the cost of the visas over a number of years. How long you can stay This is a temporary visa. You can stay in Australia for 2 years. The visa period starts on the date we grant the visa. The visa is granted with multiple entry. You can travel outside Australia and return as many times as you want within 2 years. Stay longer You can't stay in Australia longer by extending or reapplying for this visa. You can apply for a different visa. Include family You can include members of the family unit in your application when you apply. You are required to include details of all your family members in your application form whether they are migrating or not. Family members who apply for the visa must meet our health and character requirements. Family members who are not coming to Australia might also have to meet our health and character requirements. Learn more about health requirements Learn more about character requirements Newborn child Find out what to do if your child is born after you apply Cost This visa costs from AUD34,170.00 for a single applicant. There are additional charges for each family member who applies with you. You pay for this visa in 2 parts called instalments. Pay the first instalment when you apply. Pay the second instalment when we ask you to. You might also have to pay other costs for each applicant for health checks, police certificates and biometrics. For more information see Fees and charges for other services To work out what your visa will cost see current visa pricing . See more about visa fees and charges Apply from You must be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when you apply and when we make a decision on your application. Any family members who apply for the visa with you must also be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when you apply. If you apply for this visa in Australia while on a temporary visa with a no further stay condition, your application will be invalid, unless you apply for a waiver of this condition. Processing times The demand for Parent visas is greater than the number of places available each year. As a result, processing times for these applications are lengthy. Applications for this visa are subject to capping and queueing and are processed in the order we receive them. For an indication of processing times for this visa, see Parent visa queue release dates Your application might take longer to process if: you don’t fill it in correctly you don’t include all of the documents we need or we need more information from you and/or your information takes a long time to verify. We can’t process your application if you don’t pay the correct visa application charge. We will notify you if this is the case and if necessary return your application. For further information on Migration Program outcomes against planning for each migration program year, read the Reports on Migration Programs Assessment We assess applications for this visa in 2 stages: An initial assessment to check eligibility and either add the application to the queue or refuse it. As places become available, applications are released from the queue for final assessment. Don’t arrange to stay permanently in Australia until your visa is granted. We will let you know in writing if we grant you the visa. Consider another visa Other Parent visas available include the: Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864) . This is a permanent visa that may be processed faster but costs more. Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) visa (subclass 884) Followed by a permanent Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864) . This 2-step visa process costs more than the Aged Parent visa (subclass 804). It also costs more than applying directly for the Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864), but the cost is spread across the 2 visas over a longer period. Sponsored Parent (Temporary) visa (subclass 870) This is a temporary visa allowing parents to visit their children in Australia for up to 3 or 5 years at a time and a cumulative maximum 10 year period. You can view all visa options on our Visa list page Your obligations You and your family members must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws. See what conditions might be attached to this visa on our visa conditions page Visa label We will digitally link your visa to your passport. You will not get a label in your passport. Eligibility From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, see Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications Not have this visa You can't apply for this visa if you have already applied for or hold a Sponsored Parent (Temporary) (subclass 870) visa. Have a sponsor Details You must be sponsored by an eligible sponsor. Usually you would be sponsored by an eligible child. If your child is under 18, you can be sponsored by an eligible relative or community organisation. We must approve the sponsorship. Meet the balance of family test Details You must meet the balance of family test . You do so if: at least half of your children and step children are eligible children, or there are more eligible children than children living in any other single country For more information and examples of how the test is applied, visit balance of family test Be this age You must be old enough to receive the age pension in Australia Meet the health requirement Details You and any family members who apply for the visa with you must meet our health requirement We might also ask that other non-migrating family members meet the requirement. Meet the character requirement Details You and any family members who apply for the visa with you must meet our character requirement We might also ask that other non-migrating family members meet the requirement. Have paid back your debt to the Australian Government If you or any member of your family owe the Australian Government money you or they must have paid it back or have an approved formal arrangement in place to pay it back. Not have had a visa cancelled or a previous application refused Details We will consider your immigration history when we make a decision on your application, which means you might not be eligible for this visa if you have had a visa cancelled or refused. In some circumstances you may still apply for a permanent visa if you have had a visa cancelled or an application refused, see Limitations on applications in Australia (129KB PDF) If applying for a visa from outside Australia, see Can I go to Australia If you want immigration assistance, see Who can help with your visa application Sign the Australian Values Statement Details ​If you are 18 years of age or older, you must: have read, or had explained to you, the Life in Australia booklet sign an Australian Values Statement . This confirms you will respect the Australian way of life and obey Australian laws. Best interests of the child We will not grant this visa if it is not in the best interests of an applicant under 18. Meet all these criteria? Check how to apply in our step by step guide. Step by step From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, see Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications Step 1 Before you apply Check your passport. If you need help with your application, get someone to act on your behalf. Show steps Check your passport You don't have to have a valid passport to apply but you must provide details of your most recent passport. However, we will only grant the visa if you have a valid passport. Get help with your application Only some people can help you with your application. If you appoint someone to give you immigration assistance they must be one of the following: registered migration agent legal practitioner an exempt person You can appoint anyone to receive documents on your behalf relating to your visa matter. To learn more visit authorised recipients See how If you have an existing Parent visa application If you have applied for a different Parent visa but we have not made a decision about that visa, you must withdraw that application at the same time that you apply for this visa. Use Part B of Form 47PA Application for a parent to migrate to Australia (3MB PDF) See how Step 2 Gather your documents Gather all your documents, including for any partner or dependants who might be applying with you. You will also need your sponsor documents. Show steps Provide accurate information There are consequences to not providing accurate or complete information. To learn more, visit providing accurate information Identity documents We need proof of your identity. If you can't prove your identity: we will refuse your visa application we might not grant you another visa for 10 years we might not grant any family members you listed on your application a visa for 10 years. Provide the pages of your current passport showing your photo, personal details, and passport issue and expiry dates. Also provide: a national identity card, if you have one proof of change of name. Documents that prove a change of name include: a marriage or divorce certificate change of name documents from an Australian Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages, or the relevant overseas authority documents that shows other names you have been known by. See how Sponsor documents Your application must be sponsored by an eligible sponsor. Your sponsor must complete Form 40 Sponsorship for migration to Australia (469KB PDF) See how Balance of family documents You must show us that you meet the balance of family test . You can do so by giving us: evidence of how you are related to each child evidence of each child's Australian citizenship or country of permanent residence evidence that your child should not be included in the balance-of-family test (for example, their death certificate). See how Character documents We might ask you for character documents, including police certificates. Don't arrange a police check until we ask you to. Learn more about police certificates See how Tell us you are getting help To nominate someone to: receive your correspondence, use Form 956A Appointment or withdrawal of an authorised recipient (301KB PDF) provide immigration assistance, use Form 956 Appointment of a registered migration agent, legal practitioner or exempt person (308KB PDF) Send written notification or your forms with your paper application. See how Dependants under 18 documents For every dependent under 18 years old who is applying with you, provide: identity documents evidence of your relationship with them, like a birth or marriage certificate character documents, if applicable. See how Parental responsibility documents You must get consent for any applicant under 18 years of age to migrate to Australia from anyone who: has a legal right to decide where the child lives and is not coming to Australia with the child. They must complete either: Form 1229 Consent form to grant an Australian visa to a child under the age of 18 years (276KB PDF) a statutory declaration giving their consent for the child to stay in Australia on this visa. Alternatively, you can show us: an Australian court order that allows your child to migrate to Australia, or that the laws of your home country allow them to migrate. Include: an identity document that shows the signature and photo of the person who completed the form or declaration, such as a passport or driver’s licence adoption papers or other court documents if applicable. See how Dependants over 18 documents To be included in your visa application as a dependent child, your child must be: under 18 years over 18 years of age but not yet turned 23, and dependent on you or your partner over 23 years of age, unable to earn a living to support themselves due to physical or cognitive limitations and dependent on you or your partner. For every dependant 18 years old or older who is applying with you, provide: identity documents documents about their other relationships, if applicable character documents proof of dependency. If your child is likely to turn 23 while your application is being processed, you will need to provide evidence they are dependent on you due to disability. Provide: identity documents documents about their other relationships, if applicable character documents. Proof of dependency You need to prove that this person is dependent on you. Provide: a completed Form 47a Details of a child or other dependent family member aged 18 years or over (307KB PDF) proof of your relationship with the dependent such as a birth certificate or adoption papers. You must also prove this person has been financially dependent on you for at least 12 months before you apply. You could provide: proof they live with you their tax records proof they are currently studying. See how Partner documents Provide: identity documents character documents documents about other relationships, if applicable. Provide either: your current marriage certificate or enough documents to prove you have been in a de facto relationship with your partner for at least 12 months before you apply. Documents that prove your de facto relationship include: joint bank account statements billing accounts in joint names joint leases or mortgages documents that show you have lived at the same address as your partner. See how Photographs Provide 4 recent photos (45mm x 35mm) of anyone included in the application. Photographs must be: 45mm x 35mm less than 6 months old good quality colour. We don't accept laser copies a full-face view of your head and shoulders taken against a plain light-coloured background. You can wear untinted prescription glasses. If you wear a head covering for religious reasons, you can show only your face. See how Prepare your documents See how Translate Have all non-English documents translated into English. Provide original copies and translated documents in your application. Translators in Australia must be accredited by the National Accreditation Authority for Translators and Interpreters Translators outside Australia don't have to be accredited. But on each translation, they must include their: full name address and telephone number qualifications and experience in the language they are translating. These details must be in English. See how Certify Don't certify police certificates. You need to send us the originals. Have all other documents certified . This includes: non-English documents English translations. See how Keep Keep a copy of your completed application. Send Send us: original police certificates, if applicable certified copies of all other documents as much relevant information as possible to help us make a decision on your application each document only once, even if you are using to show more than one thing all documents with your application, if you can. Step 3 Apply for the visa You must apply for the visa on paper. You must be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when you submit your application. You can’t apply for this visa if you have already applied for or hold a Sponsored Parent (Temporary) (subclass 870) visa. Show steps Apply on paper Complete Form 47PA Application for a parent to migrate to Australia (3MB PDF) Your sponsor must complete Form 40 Sponsorship for migration to Australia (469KB PDF) Whether migrating or not, each member of the family unit aged 18 years or over must also complete Form 47A Details of child or other dependent family member aged 18 years or over (307KB PDF) You must complete all forms in English. You must pay the first instalment when you apply. For payment options see how to pay You can’t apply for this visa in person. Send your application by post or courier to the address on the form. Include all required documents, forms and evidence of payment of application charge with your application. Don't send original documents with your application, only send certified copies . Keep a copy of your completed application for your own records, including any supporting documents. If any of the above steps are incomplete, your application may be invalid. We don't process invalid applications. We will notify you if this is the case, and if requested, return your application. See how Step 4 After you apply We will let you know when we have received your application and documents. There are other things you need to know and might have to do. Show steps Importing your paper application After you or someone else has submitted your paper application, import it into your ImmiAccount. You can do this after you receive your acknowledgement letter. Importing your application into ImmiAccount gives you access to online services making it easier to manage your application. You can use our online services in ImmiAccount to: attach supporting documents to your application view messages sent to you update your details view the status of your application. Follow these steps to import your application: Create a new ImmiAccount or log into your existing ImmiAccount. Our website has instructions on how to use ImmiAccount Once you log in, import your application by entering your: application ID date of birth identity document number (ImmiCard, passport or Titre de Voyage number). For more information, see Apply and Manage your application in ImmiAccount You can import both new and on-hand applications. See how Status updates We can't provide updates on your application's progress within normal processing times. We will let you know if we need anything further. Learn more about processing times at Parent visa queue release dates Travel Tell us if you want to travel outside Australia while we process your application. We need to know because you must be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when we make our decision. If you leave Australia, make sure you have a valid visa to return. Learn about visa expiry See how Health exams We will let you know if you need health examinations Biometrics We might ask for biometrics . This includes fingerprints and photos. We will let you know if you need to provide them. Send more information If you have imported your application into ImmiAccount, you can use it to upload any additional documents that you did not provide with your application. Alternatively, you can send any documents to the Parent Visa Centre in Perth. We might also ask you to provide more information. See how Stay lawful Make sure you stay lawful by holding a valid visa while we process your application. When you apply for this visa in Australia, you are likely to be granted a bridging visa. If your current visa expires before we make a decision on your application, the bridging visa will start. You can stay in Australia on the bridging visa while we process your new visa application. Don't cancel your current visa. If you do, you will: be staying in Australia unlawfully not be eligible for a bridging visa. Learn more about visa expiry See how Pay the second instalment You must pay a second instalment before we will grant the visa. We will send you an invoice when it is due. If you don’t pay the invoice, we will refuse your application. See how Add family members You might be able to add family members to your application before we make a decision. Complete and send us Form 1436 Adding an additional applicant after lodgement (481KB PDF) You will also need to provide evidence of your relationship and the family member’s passport. If you have imported your application into ImmiAccount, you can use it to upload the completed form and any additional documents. Any family members you add to your application after you apply must be in Australia when you add them. See how Newborn child Find out what to do if your child is born after you apply See how Mistakes on your application Let us know as soon as you can if you make a mistake on your application. Complete Form 1023 Notification of incorrect answers (168KB PDF) If you have imported your application into ImmiAccount, you can use it to upload the completed form. See how Help with your application Let us know if you no longer want someone to: receive your correspondence - complete Form 956A Appointment or withdrawal of an authorised recipient (301KB PDF) provide immigration advice - complete Form 956 Appointment of a registered migration agent, legal practitioner or exempt person (308KB PDF) Send written notification or your forms to the office you submitted your application to. If you have imported your application into ImmiAccount, you can use it to upload the completed form. For more information see Who can help you with your application See how Tell us if things change Things you need to let us know about after you have applied include: changes to your phone number, address or passport changes to your marital or de facto status the birth of a child you want to withdraw your application. See what to do if your situation changes See how Step 5 Visa outcome You must be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when we make a decision on your application. We will let you know our decision in writing. If we grant you the visa, we will let you know: your visa grant number the date your visa starts your visa conditions We recommend you keep a copy of our decision. If we refuse your visa we will let you know: why we refused the visa whether you have a right to a review of the decision We will not refund the application fee if we refuse your application. When you have this visa From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, see Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications In Australia Leaving Australia After you leave In Australia What you must do when you have this visa You and your family members must meet all visa conditions and obey all Australian laws. Tell us if things change See what to do if your situation changes What you can do on your visa See your visa expiry, conditions and work and study entitlements in VEVO See how long you can stay This is a temporary visa. You can stay in Australia for 2 years. To see when you must leave, use VEVO Staying longer You can’t stay in Australia longer by extending this visa. You must apply for a new visa if you want to stay longer. See your options If you want to stay in Australia permanently, before your subclass 884 visa expires, you can apply for a Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864) In exceptional circumstances we might allow you to apply for the subclass 864 visa after this. Contact the Parent Visa Centre at the Perth office in Western Australia at the address on the application form or by submitting the Parent visa processing centre form Travelling on your visa You can travel outside Australia and return as many times as you want while the visa is valid. See your visa expiry and conditions in VEVO Proving you have a visa To prove you have a visa and show your conditions to someone, use VEVO To get proof of your travel in and out of Australia, request your international movement records Working This visa enables you to work in Australia. You are protected by Australian workplace law. See your workplace rights and entitlements Leaving Australia Before you leave Check your travel documents You must have a valid passport or other travel document to leave Australia. Ensure your visa is still valid See what to do if your visa has expired or is about to expire At the border Departures SmartGate We have an automated process that uses facial recognition technology and your ePassport. You might be able to leave the airport faster if you use SmartGate After you leave Proving you have been to Australia To get proof of your travel in and out of Australia, request your international movement records
main_content:
===== main placeholder ==========================================
Subclass 884

# Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) visa

Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) visa

This temporary visa lets the aged parent of a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident or eligible New Zealand citizen stay temporarily in Australia.

This temporary visa lets the aged parent of a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident or eligible New Zealand citizen stay temporarily in Australia.

This temporary visa lets the aged parent of a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident or eligible New Zealand citizen stay temporarily in Australia.

Overview

From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, seeUpdate to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications.​

From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, seeUpdate to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications.

From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, see
Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications
.
​

Stay

2 years

#### Cost

Cost

From AUD34,170.00 over 2 instalments for a single applicant.For more information on additional fees that may apply, see the Costs section onAbout this visa.

#### Processing times

Processing times

The demand for Parent visas is greater than the number of places available each year. As a result, processing times for these applications are lengthy.

The demand for Parent visas is greater than the number of places available each year. As a result, processing times for these applications are lengthy.

#### With this visa you can

With this visa you can
- live in Australia for up to 2 years
live in Australia for up to 2 years
- work and study in Australia (you will not receive government support)
work and study in Australia (you will not receive government support)
- apply for a permanentContributory Aged Parent (subclass 864) visa.
apply for a permanent
Contributory Aged Parent (subclass 864) visa
.

See all conditions

#### You must

You must
- have an eligible child who is a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident or eligible New Zealand citizen
have an eligible child who is a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident or eligible New Zealand citizen
- be old enough to receive the age pension in Australia
be old enough to receive the age pension in Australia
- not have already applied for or hold a Sponsored Parent (Temporary) (Subclass 870) visa when applying for this visa.
not have already applied for or hold a Sponsored Parent (Temporary) (Subclass 870) visa when applying for this visa.

#### Help with your visa

Help with your visa

### Process

Process
About this visa

From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, seeUpdate to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications.​

From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, seeUpdate to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications.

From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, see
Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications
.

## With this visa you can

With this visa you can
- live in Australia for up to 2 years
live in Australia for up to 2 years
- work and study in Australia (you will not receive government support)
work and study in Australia (you will not receive government support)
- apply for a permanentContributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864)
apply for a permanent
Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864)

### Apply for a Contributory Aged Parent (subclass 864) visa

Apply for a Contributory Aged Parent (subclass 864) visa

You can apply for the permanent subclass 864 visa as a two-step process by first applying for a Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) subclass 884 visa. Applying for the subclass 884 visa and then the subclass 864 visa allows you to spread the cost of the visas over a number of years.

You can apply for the permanent subclass 864 visa as a two-step process by first applying for a Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) subclass 884 visa. Applying for the subclass 884 visa and then the subclass 864 visa allows you to spread the cost of the visas over a number of years.

## How long you can stay

How long you can stay

This is a temporary visa. You can stay in Australia for 2 years.

This is a temporary visa. You can stay in Australia for 2 years.

The visa period starts on the date we grant the visa.

The visa period starts on the date we grant the visa.

The visa is granted with multiple entry. You can travel outside Australia and return as many times as you want within 2 years.

The visa is granted with multiple entry. You can travel outside Australia and return as many times as you want within 2 years.

## Stay longer

Stay longer

You can't stay in Australia longer by extending or reapplying for this visa. You can apply for a different visa.

You can't stay in Australia longer by extending or reapplying for this visa. You can apply for a different visa.

## Include family

Include family

You can includemembers of the family unitin your application when you apply.

You can include
members of the family unit
in your application when you apply.

You are required to include details of all your family members in your application form whether they are migrating or not.

You are required to include details of all your family members in your application form whether they are migrating or not.

Family members who apply for the visa must meet our health and character requirements. Family members who are not coming to Australia might also have to meet our health and character requirements.

Family members who apply for the visa must meet our health and character requirements. Family members who are not coming to Australia might also have to meet our health and character requirements.

Learn more abouthealth requirements.

Learn more about
health requirements
.

Learn more aboutcharacter requirements.

Learn more about
character requirements
.

### Newborn child

Newborn child

Find out what to do ifyour child is born after you apply.

Find out what to do if
your child is born after you apply
.

## Cost

Cost

This visa costs from AUD34,170.00 for a single applicant. There are additional charges for each family member who applies with you.

This visa costs from AUD34,170.00 for a single applicant. There are additional charges for each family member who applies with you.

You pay for this visa in 2 parts called instalments. Pay the first instalment when you apply. Pay the second instalment when we ask you to.

You pay for this visa in 2 parts called instalments. Pay the first instalment when you apply. Pay the second instalment when we ask you to.

You might also have to pay other costs for each applicant for health checks, police certificates and biometrics. For more information seeFees and charges for other services.

You might also have to pay other costs for each applicant for health checks, police certificates and biometrics. For more information see
Fees and charges for other services
.

To work out what your visa will cost seecurrent visa pricing. See more aboutvisa fees and charges.

To work out what your visa will cost see
current visa pricing
. See more about
visa fees and charges
.

## Apply from

Apply from

You must be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when you apply and when we make a decision on your application.

You must be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when you apply and when we make a decision on your application.

Any family members who apply for the visa with you must also be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when you apply.

Any family members who apply for the visa with you must also be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when you apply.

If you apply for this visa in Australia while on a temporary visa with a no further stay condition, your application will be invalid, unless you apply for a waiver of this condition.

If you apply for this visa in Australia while on a temporary visa with a no further stay condition, your application will be invalid, unless you apply for a waiver of this condition.

## Processing times

Processing times

The demand for Parent visas is greater than the number of places available each year. As a result, processing times for these applications are lengthy.

The demand for Parent visas is greater than the number of places available each year. As a result, processing times for these applications are lengthy.

Applications for this visa are subject tocapping and queueingand are processed in the order we receive them.

Applications for this visa are subject to
capping and queueing
and are processed in the order we receive them.

For an indication of processing times for this visa, seeParent visa queue release dates.

For an indication of processing times for this visa, see
Parent visa queue release dates
.

Your application might take longer to process if:

Your application might take longer to process if:
- you don’t fill it in correctly
you don’t fill it in correctly
- you don’t include all of the documents we need or we need more information from you and/or
you don’t include all of the documents we need or we need more information from you and/or
- your information takes a long time to verify.
your information takes a long time to verify.

We can’t process your application if you don’t pay the correct visa application charge. We will notify you if this is the case and if necessary return your application.

We can’t process your application if you don’t pay the correct visa application charge. We will notify you if this is the case and if necessary return your application.

For further information on Migration Program outcomes against planning for each migration program year, read theReports on Migration Programs.

For further information on Migration Program outcomes against planning for each migration program year, read the
Reports on Migration Programs
.

### Assessment

Assessment

We assess applications for this visa in 2 stages:

We assess applications for this visa in 2 stages:
1. An initial assessment to check eligibility and either add the application to the queue or refuse it.
An initial assessment to check eligibility and either add the application to the queue or refuse it.
2. As places become available, applications are released from the queue for final assessment.
As places become available, applications are released from the queue for final assessment.

Don’t arrange to stay permanently in Australia until your visa is granted. We will let you know in writing if we grant you the visa.

Don’t arrange to stay permanently in Australia until your visa is granted. We will let you know in writing if we grant you the visa.

### Consider another visa

Consider another visa

Other Parent visas available include the:

Other Parent visas available include the:
- Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864). This is a permanent visa that may be processed faster but costs more.
Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864)
. This is a permanent visa that may be processed faster but costs more.
- Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) visa (subclass 884).Followed by a permanentContributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864). This 2-step visa process costs more than the Aged Parent visa (subclass 804). It also costs more than applying directly for the Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864), but the cost is spread across the 2 visas over a longer period.
Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) visa (subclass 884)
.
Followed by a permanent
Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864)
. This 2-step visa process costs more than the Aged Parent visa (subclass 804). It also costs more than applying directly for the Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864), but the cost is spread across the 2 visas over a longer period.
- Sponsored Parent (Temporary) visa (subclass 870).This is a temporary visa allowing parents to visit their children in Australia for up to 3 or 5 years at a time and a cumulative maximum 10 year period.
Sponsored Parent (Temporary) visa (subclass 870)
.
This is a temporary visa allowing parents to visit their children in Australia for up to 3 or 5 years at a time and a cumulative maximum 10 year period.

## Visa label

Visa label

We will digitally link your visa to your passport. You will not get a label in your passport.

We will digitally link your visa to your passport. You will not get a label in your passport.
Eligibility

From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, seeUpdate to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications.​

From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, seeUpdate to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications.

From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, see
Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications
.

## Not have this visa

Not have this visa

You can't apply for this visa if you have already applied for or hold a Sponsored Parent (Temporary) (subclass 870) visa.

You can't apply for this visa if you have already applied for or hold a Sponsored Parent (Temporary) (subclass 870) visa.

## Have a sponsor

Have a sponsor
Details

You must be sponsored by an eligible sponsor.

You must be sponsored by an eligible sponsor.

Usually you would be sponsored by an eligible child. If your child is under 18, you can be sponsored by an eligible relative or community organisation.

Usually you would be sponsored by an eligible child. If your child is under 18, you can be sponsored by an eligible relative or community organisation.

We must approve the sponsorship.

We must approve the sponsorship.

## Meet the balance of family test

Meet the balance of family test
Details

You must meet thebalance of family test. You do so if:

You must meet the
balance of family test
. You do so if:
- at least half of your children and step children are eligible children, or
at least half of your children and step children are eligible children, or
- there are more eligible children than children living in any other single country
there are more eligible children than children living in any other single country

For more information and examples of how the test is applied, visitbalance of family test.

For more information and examples of how the test is applied, visit
balance of family test
.

## Have paid back your debt to the Australian Government

Have paid back your debt to the Australian Government

If you or any member of your family owe the Australian Government money you or they must have paid it back or have an approved formal arrangement in place to pay it back.

If you or any member of your family owe the Australian Government money you or they must have paid it back or have an approved formal arrangement in place to pay it back.

## Not have had a visa cancelled or a previous application refused

Not have had a visa cancelled or a previous application refused
Details

We will consider your immigration history when we make a decision on your application, which means you might not be eligible for this visa if you have had a visa cancelled or refused.

We will consider your immigration history when we make a decision on your application, which means you might not be eligible for this visa if you have had a visa cancelled or refused.

#### Identity documents

Identity documents

We need proof of your identity. If you can't prove your identity:

We need proof of your identity. If you can't prove your identity:
- we will refuse your visa application
we will refuse your visa application
- we might not grant you another visa for 10 years
we might not grant you another visa for 10 years

we might not grant any family members you listed on your application a visa for 10 years.

Provide the pages of your current passport showing your photo, personal details, and passport issue and expiry dates.

Provide the pages of your current passport showing your photo, personal details, and passport issue and expiry dates.

Also provide:

Also provide:
- a national identity card, if you have one
a national identity card, if you have one
- proof of change of name.
proof of change of name.

Documents that prove a change of name include:

Documents that prove a change of name include:

a marriage or divorce certificate

change of name documents from an Australian Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages, or the relevant overseas authority

#### Parental responsibility documents

Parental responsibility documents

You must get consent for any applicant under 18 years of age to migrate to Australia from anyone who:

- has a legal right to decide where the child lives and
has a legal right to decide where the child lives and

is not coming to Australia with the child.

They must complete either:

They must complete either:
- Form 1229 Consent form to grant an Australian visa to a child under the age of 18 years (276KB PDF)
Form 1229 Consent form to grant an Australian visa to a child under the age of 18 years (276KB PDF)
- a statutory declaration giving their consent for the child to stay in Australia on this visa.
a statutory declaration giving their consent for the child to stay in Australia on this visa.

Alternatively, you can show us:

Alternatively, you can show us:
- an Australian court order that allows your child to migrate to Australia, or
an Australian court order that allows your child to migrate to Australia, or
- that the laws of your home country allow them to migrate.
that the laws of your home country allow them to migrate.

Include:

Importing your paper application

After you or someone else has submitted your paper application, import it into your ImmiAccount. You can do this after you receive your acknowledgement letter.

#### Stay lawful

Stay lawful

Make sure you stay lawful by holding a valid visa while we process your application.

Make sure you stay lawful by holding a valid visa while we process your application.

When you apply for this visa in Australia, you are likely to be granted a bridging visa. If your current visa expires before we make a decision on your application, the bridging visa will start. You can stay in Australia on the bridging visa while we process your new visa application.

When you apply for this visa in Australia, you are likely to be granted a bridging visa. If your current visa expires before we make a decision on your application, the bridging visa will start. You can stay in Australia on the bridging visa while we process your new visa application.

Don't cancel your current visa. If you do, you will:

Don't cancel your current visa. If you do, you will:
- be staying in Australia unlawfully
be staying in Australia unlawfully
- not be eligible for a bridging visa.
not be eligible for a bridging visa.

#### Pay the second instalment

Pay the second instalment

You must pay a second instalment before we will grant the visa. We will send you an invoice when it is due. If you don’t pay the invoice, we will refuse your application.

You must pay a second instalment before we will grant the visa. We will send you an invoice when it is due. If you don’t pay the invoice, we will refuse your application.

Add family members

Step 5

Step 5
Visa outcome

You must be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when we make a decision on your application. We will let you know our decision in writing.

You must be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when we make a decision on your application. We will let you know our decision in writing.

If we grant you the visa, we will let you know:

If we grant you the visa, we will let you know:
- your visa grant number
your visa grant number
- the date your visa starts
the date your visa starts
- your visa conditions
your visa conditions

We recommend you keep a copy of our decision.

We recommend you keep a copy of our decision.

If we refuse your visa we will let you know:

If we refuse your visa we will let you know:
- why we refused the visa
why we refused the visa
- whether you have a right to a review of the decision
whether you have a right to a review of the decision

We will not refund the application fee if we refuse your application.

We will not refund the application fee if we refuse your application.
When you have this visa

From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, seeUpdate to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications.​

Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported. For more information, seeUpdate to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Parent visa applications.

.

## In Australia

In Australia

### What you must do when you have this visa

What you must do when you have this visa

You and your family members must meet all visa conditions and obey all Australian laws.

What you can do on your visa

### See how long you can stay

See how long you can stay

This is a temporary visa. You can stay in Australia for 2 years.

This is a temporary visa. You can stay in Australia for 2 years.

To see when you must leave, useVEVO.

To see when you must leave, use
VEVO

### Staying longer

Staying longer

You can’t stay in Australia longer by extending this visa. You must apply for a new visa if you want to stay longer.See your options.

You can’t stay in Australia longer by extending this visa. You must apply for a new visa if you want to stay longer.
See your options
.

If you want to stay in Australia permanently, before your subclass 884 visa expires, you can apply for aContributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864).

If you want to stay in Australia permanently, before your subclass 884 visa expires, you can apply for a
Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864)
.

In exceptional circumstances we might allow you to apply for the subclass 864 visa after this. Contact the Parent Visa Centre at the Perth office in Western Australia at the address on the application form or by submitting theParent visa processing centre form.

In exceptional circumstances we might allow you to apply for the subclass 864 visa after this. Contact the Parent Visa Centre at the Perth office in Western Australia at the address on the application form or by submitting the
Parent visa processing centre form
.
